page.title: 04Dairy Farming, World's End
page.content: In our area there is one dairy farm compared to 3 or 4 about 20 years ago. It has 3000 acres and both cows and 1000 pigs. There are about 110 cows to every 15 acres so it is intensively farmed. Pastoral farming is cheaper than arable farming and it is easy to change from arable to pastoral so it is likely that more farms will change in the future. Many pieces of machinery are used making life easier. Nowadays one farmhand represents 4 or 5 only 25 years ago. Even so, unemployment is very low compared to national figures. The M4 also helps farms in two ways. It is easier to travel to market towns and has pushed the price of surrounding land up a lot.
